ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Basic language skills like grammar, conjugation, and pronunciation. Also learned a lot about Czech culture
I learned a better understanding of the czech language and a higher grasp of the vocabulary and structure.
How to conjugate verbs in the past present and future tense. Learned about czech presidents and czech culture through movies and presentations

Present tense
Past tense
Future tense
New vocabulary words
Czech culture
How to speak czech

I learned Czech grammar, how to conjugate verbs, how to read a story and answer questions, how to convert from 1st to 3rd person, hard and soft nouns and how to change their endings appropriately, animals, colors, days of the week, and more
A deeper understanding of Czech.
I excelled in my learning skills throughout the semester in this course. In a wide variety of ways we were shown how to learn the Czech language, it was difficult but extremely fun.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Karen Von Kunes is an absolute gem of a professor at Yale and is definitely the greatest strength of this course.
The strengths of this class are the teacher. She cares so much about us and wants us to do well, but also teaches us and doesn't let us slide.
The best and most interesting class ive taken. Maybe more presentations because i learned the most
The strengths are how much the students loved the teacher, the weaknesses was that sometimes she overestimated our ability
Strengths: KVK is a teacher who really cares about her students learning
Strengths would be the professor and how knowledgeable she is in teaching the Czech language.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: If you want to learn a unique and interesting language with an excellent professor, I highly recommend czech. She creates a fun and welcoming learning environment. It is a great way to try a new thing.
Yes, interesting language and workload and testing is simple but challenging and works well to teach the language
Yes! Best course ive taken at yale
One thousand percent.
Yes, it was a great course that I thoroughly enjoyed
Yes absolutely! Czech was my most fun class and I looked forward to going and learning the Czech language
yes.
Yes, KvK is great!
Absolutely, a fantastic class to learn the Czech language, which is not very commonly known.
